monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.custom_events_classic.usage_by_entity
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: (DPS) Custom Events Classic billing usage by monitored entity
monitor-dynatrace.description: The number of custom events ingested split by monitored entity. Custom events include events sent to Dynatrace via the Events API or events created by a log event extraction rule. For details on the events billed, refer to the usage_by_event_info metric. To improve performance and avoid exceeding query limits when working with longer timeframes, use the total metric.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.custom_metrics_classic.usage.other_by_entity
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: (DPS) Billed metric data points reported and split by other entities
monitor-dynatrace.description: The number of billed metric data points split by entities that cannot be assigned to a host. The values reported in this metric are not eligible for included metric deduction and will be billed as is. This trailing metric is reported at 15-minute intervals with up to a 15-minute delay. To improve performance and avoid exceeding query limits when working with longer timeframes, use the total metric.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.custom_traces_classic.usage_by_entity
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: (DPS) Custom Traces Classic billing usage by monitored entity
monitor-dynatrace.description: The number of spans ingested split by monitored entity. A span is a single operation within a distributed trace, ingested into Dynatrace. For details on span types, refer to the usage_by_span_type metric. To improve performance and avoid exceeding query limits when working with longer timeframes, use the total metric.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.ddu.includedMetricDduPerHost
monitor-dynatrace.description: Included Davis data units per host

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.ddu.includedMetricPerHost
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: DDU included metric data points per host
monitor-dynatrace.description: Included metric data points per host

RELATIONAL_DATABASE_SERVICE, REMOTE_PLUGIN_MODULE, REQUEST_ATTRIBUTE, RUNTIME_COMPONENT, S3BUCKET, SERVICE, SERVICE_INSTANCE, SERVICE_METHOD, SERVICE_METHOD_GROUP, SOFTWARE_COMPONENT, SWIFT_CONTAINER, SYNTHETIC_LOCATION, SYNTHETIC_TEST, SYNTHETIC_TEST_STEP, VCENTER, VIRTUALMACHINE, VMWARE_DATACENTER
monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.ddu.metrics.byEntityRaw
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: DDU metrics consumption by monitored entity w/o host-unit included DDUs
monitor-dynatrace.description: License consumption of Davis data units by metrics pool split by monitored entity (aggregates host-unit included metrics, so value might be higher than actual consumption)

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.ddu.traces.byEntity
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: DDU traces consumption by monitored entity
monitor-dynatrace.description: License consumption of Davis data units by traces pool split by monitored entity

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.foundation_and_discovery.usage_per_host
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: (DPS) Foundation & Discovery billing usage per host
monitor-dynatrace.description: The host-hours being monitored by Foundation & Discovery, counted in 15 min intervals.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.foundation_and_discovery.metric_data_points.ingested_by_host
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: (DPS) Ingested metric data points for Foundation & Discovery per host
monitor-dynatrace.description: The number of metric data points split by Foundation & Discovery hosts.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.full_stack_monitoring.usage_per_host
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: (DPS) Full-Stack Monitoring billing usage per host
monitor-dynatrace.description: The GiB memory per host being monitored in full-stack mode, counted in 15 min intervals. For example, a host with 8 GiB of RAM monitored for 1 hour has 4 data points with a value of `2`. To improve performance and avoid exceeding query limits when working with longer timeframes, use the total metric.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.full_stack_monitoring.metric_data_points.ingested_by_host
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: (DPS) Metric data points reported and split by Full-Stack hosts
monitor-dynatrace.description: The number of metric data points split by Full-Stack hosts. The values reported in this metric are eligible for included-metric-data-point deduction. This trailing metric is reported at 15-minute intervals with up to a 15-minute delay. The pool of available included metrics for a "15-minute interval" is visible via builtin:billing.full_stack_monitoring.metric_data_points.included . To improve performance and avoid exceeding query limits when working with longer timeframes, use the total metric.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.infrastructure_monitoring.usage_per_host
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: (DPS) Infrastructure Monitoring billing usage per host
monitor-dynatrace.description: The host-hours being monitored in infrastructure-only mode, counted in 15 min intervals. A host monitored for the whole hour has 4 data points with a value of 0.25, regardless of the memory size. To improve performance and avoid exceeding query limits when working with longer timeframes, use the total metric.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.infrastructure_monitoring.metric_data_points.ingested_by_host
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: (DPS) Metric data points reported and split by Infrastructure-monitored hosts
monitor-dynatrace.description: The number of metric data points split by Infrastructure-monitored hosts. The values reported in this metric are eligible for included-metric-data-point deduction. This trailing metric is reported at 15-minute intervals with up to a 15-minute delay. The pool of available included metrics for a "15-minute interval" is visible via builtin:billing.infrastructure_monitoring.metric_data_points.included . To improve performance and avoid exceeding query limits when working with longer timeframes, use the total metric.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.log_monitoring_classic.usage_by_entity
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: (DPS) Log Monitoring Classic billing usage by monitored entity
monitor-dynatrace.description: The number of log records ingested split by monitored entity. A log record is recognized by either a timestamp or a JSON object. For details on the log path, refer to the usage_by_log_path metric. To improve performance and avoid exceeding query limits when working with longer timeframes, use the total metric.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.mainframe_monitoring.usage
monitor-dynatrace.description: The total number of MSU-hours being monitored, counted in 15 min intervals.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.runtime_application_protection.usage_per_host
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: (DPS) Runtime Application Protection billing usage per host
monitor-dynatrace.description: GiB-memory per host protected with Runtime Application Protection (Application Security), counted at 15-minute intervals. For example, a host with 8 GiB of RAM monitored for 1 hour has 4 data points with a value of `2`. To improve performance and avoid exceeding query limits when working with longer timeframes, use the total metric.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.runtime_vulnerability_analytics.usage_per_host
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: (DPS) Runtime Vulnerability Analytics billing usage per host
monitor-dynatrace.description: GiB-memory per hosts protected with Runtime Vulnerability Analytics (Application Security), counted at 15-minute intervals. For example, a host with 8 GiB of RAM monitored for 1 hour has 4 data points with a value of `2`. To improve performance and avoid exceeding query limits when working with longer timeframes, use the total metric.

SYNTHETIC_LOCATION, SYNTHETIC_TEST, SYNTHETIC_TEST_STEP, VCENTER, VIRTUALMACHINE, VMWARE_DATACENTER
monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:billing.serverless_functions_classic.usage_by_entity
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: (DPS) Serverless Functions Classic billing usage by monitored entity
monitor-dynatrace.description: The number of invocations of the serverless function split by monitored entity. The term "function invocations" is equivalent to "function requests" or "function executions". For details on which functions are invoked, refer to the usage_by_function metric. To improve performance and avoid exceeding query limits when working with longer timeframes, use the total metric.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.cpu.idle
monitor-dynatrace.description: Average CPU time, when the CPU didn't have anything to do

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.cpu.iowait
monitor-dynatrace.description: Percentage of time when CPU was idle during which the system had an outstanding I/O request. It is not available on Windows.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.cpu.steal
monitor-dynatrace.description: Average CPU time, when a virtual machine waits to get CPU cycles from the hypervisor. In a virtual environment, CPU cycles are shared across virtual machines on the hypervisor server. If your virtualized host displays a high CPU steal, it means CPU cycles are being taken away from your virtual machine to serve other purposes. It may indicate an overloaded hypervisor. It's available only for Linux hosts

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.cpu.system
monitor-dynatrace.description: Average CPU time when CPU was running in kernel mode

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.cpu.user
monitor-dynatrace.description: Average CPU time when CPU was running in user mode

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.disk.avail
monitor-dynatrace.description: Amount of free space available for user in file system. On Linux and AIX it is free space available for unprivileged user. It doesn't contain part of free space reserved for the root.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.disk.bytesRead
monitor-dynatrace.description: Speed of read from file system in bytes per second

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.disk.bytesWritten
monitor-dynatrace.description: Speed of write to file system in bytes per second

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.disk.free
monitor-dynatrace.description: Percentage of free space available for user in file system. On Linux and AIX it is % of free space available for unprivileged user. It doesn't contain part of free space reserved for the root.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.disk.queueLength
monitor-dynatrace.description: Average number of read and write operations in disk queue

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.disk.readOps
monitor-dynatrace.description: Number of read operations from file system per second

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.disk.readTime
monitor-dynatrace.description: Average time of read from file system. It shows average disk latency during read.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.disk.usedPct
monitor-dynatrace.description: Percentage of used space in file system

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.disk.writeOps
monitor-dynatrace.description: Number of write operations to file system per second

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.disk.writeTime
monitor-dynatrace.description: Average time of write to file system. It shows average disk latency during write.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.mem.used
monitor-dynatrace.description: Used memory is calculated by OneAgent as follows: used = total - available. So the used memory metric displayed in Dynatrace analysis views is not equal to the used memory metric displayed by system tools. At the same time, it's important to remember that system tools report used memory the way they do due to historical reasons, and that this particular method of calculating used memory isn't really representative of how the Linux kernel manages memory in modern systems. The difference in these measurements is in fact quite significant, too.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.mem.avail.bytes
monitor-dynatrace.description: The amount of memory (RAM) available on the host. The memory that is available for allocation to new or existing processes. Available memory is an estimation of how much memory is available for use without swapping.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.mem.avail.pct
monitor-dynatrace.description: The percentage of memory (RAM) available on the host. The memory that is available for allocation to new or existing processes. Available memory is an estimation of how much memory is available for use without swapping. Shows available memory as percentages.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.mem.avail.pfps
monitor-dynatrace.description: The measure of the number of page faults per second on the monitored host. This value includes soft faults and hard faults.

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:host.osService.availability
monitor-dynatrace.description: This metric provides the status of the OS service. If the OS service is running, the OS module is reporting "1" as a value of the metric. In any other case, the metric has a value of "0"Note that this metric provides data only from Classic Windows services monitoring (supported only on Windows), currently replaced by the new OS Services monitoring. To learn more, see [Classic Windows services monitoring](https://dt-url.net/classic-windows-services).

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:service.errors.fivexx.count
monitor-dynatrace.description: HTTP requests with a status code between 500 and 599 for a given key request measured on server side. To learn about failure detection, see [Configure service failure detection](https://dt-url.net/service-failuredetection).

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:service.errors.fourxx.count
monitor-dynatrace.description: HTTP requests with a status code between 400 and 499 for a given key request measured on server side. To learn about failure detection, see [Configure service failure detection](https://dt-url.net/service-failuredetection).

monitor-dynatrace.name: builtin:service.response.time
monitor-dynatrace.description: Time consumed by a particular service until a response is sent back to the calling application, process, service etc.To learn how Dynatrace calculates service timings, see [Service analysis timings](https://dt-url.net/service-timings).

monitor-dynatrace.name: func:slo.errorBudgetBurnRate.skobank_frontend
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: Error budget burn rate - SkoBank frontend

monitor-dynatrace.name: func:slo.errorBudgetBurnRate.skobank_overall
monitor-dynatrace.short-display-name: Error budget burn rate - SkoBank overall
